subject: Art & Design
title: Hip-Hop Fashion: From the Streets to the Runway
description: A quick win: understand Hip-Hop Fashion: From the Streets to the Runway.

hook.text: Baggy jeans, gold chains, Timberland boots, and oversized jerseys.

buildup.text: 1980s-90s hip-hop style reflected street culture: sportswear brands (Adidas, Nike), logo-heavy luxury.

discovery.text: Run-DMC's 'My Adidas' (1986) was fashion's first celebrity-brand deal. Sneakers became cultural currency overnight.

climax.text: Virgil Abloh (Off-White, Louis Vuitton) bridged streetwear and haute couture.

punchline.text: Hip-hop didn't ask for fashion's approval. It took fashion over.

quiz.question: What was significant about Run-DMC's deal with Adidas?
options: It was fashion's first major celebrity-brand partnership
They designed the first Adidas shoe
They boycotted Nike to support Adidas
